canonical_explanation.text: Good habits help us stay healthy, happy, and safe. We should say please, thank you, and sorry. We should brush our teeth, take a bath, and wash our hands before eating. We should keep our surroundings clean by using a dustbin. We should not go with strangers or take things from them. We should follow road safety rules and not play on the road.
rules: Good manners include saying please, thank you, sorry, and excuse me.
We should brush our teeth twice a day and take a bath every day.
We must wash our hands with soap before eating and after using the toilet.
We should not throw rubbish on the road. We must use a dustbin.
We should not go with strangers or take sweets or gifts from them.
We should always tell our parents or teachers if someone makes us feel unsafe.

questions.question_text: What should we say when someone gives us something?
questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Thank you' when someone gives us something. It is a good manner to show that we are grateful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saying 'give me more', 'go away', or saying nothing is rude. We should always say 'Thank you' to show we are grateful.

questions.question_text: What should we say when we want something from someone?
questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Please' when we want something from someone. Saying please is a polite way to ask for things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Demanding rudely or being impatient is bad manners. We should always say 'Please' when we ask for something.

questions.question_text: What should we say if we accidentally bump into someone?
questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Sorry' if we bump into someone. Saying sorry shows that we care about others and feel bad for our mistake.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Blaming others or saying nothing is rude. If we accidentally bump into someone, we should politely say 'Sorry'.

questions.question_text: When should we wash our hands?

options.text: Before eating and after using the toilet

questions.explanation_correct: We should wash our hands before eating and after using the toilet. This kills germs and keeps us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Washing hands only at night or only on Sundays is not enough. We must wash our hands before eating and after using the toilet.

questions.question_text: How many times should we brush our teeth every day?
questions.explanation_correct: We should brush our teeth twice a day â€” in the morning and before going to bed. This keeps our teeth clean and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not brushing or brushing only once a week is not enough. We should brush our teeth twice every day to keep them strong and clean.

questions.question_text: What should we do to keep our body clean?
questions.explanation_correct: We should take a bath every day to keep our body clean. Bathing removes dirt and germs from our skin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing in mud all day, not bathing, or wearing dirty clothes is unhealthy. We should take a bath every day.

questions.question_text: Should we go with a stranger who offers us chocolates?

options.text: Yes, if the stranger is smiling
No, we should never go with strangers
Yes, if no one is watching

questions.explanation_correct: No, we should never go with strangers. Even if they offer chocolates or toys, we should say no and tell our parents or teacher.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stranger offering chocolates may not be safe. We should NEVER go with strangers no matter what they offer. Always tell a parent or teacher.

questions.question_text: Where should we throw rubbish?
questions.explanation_correct: We should throw rubbish in a dustbin. This keeps our surroundings clean and prevents diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Throwing rubbish on the road, in the river, or anywhere is wrong and dirty. We must always use a dustbin.

questions.question_text: Is it safe to play on the road?

options.text: Yes, if there are no cars

questions.explanation_correct: No, it is very dangerous to play on the road. Vehicles can come at any time. We should play in a park or playground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even if there seem to be no cars, playing on the road is dangerous. Vehicles can come suddenly. Always play in a park or playground.

questions.question_text: What should we say when we need to pass through a group of people?

options.text: Move! Get out of the way!

questions.explanation_correct: We should say 'Excuse me' when we need to pass through people. It is a polite way to ask others to make way.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shouting, pushing, or saying nothing is rude. We should politely say 'Excuse me' when we need to pass through people.

questions.question_text: We should wash our hands with soap before eating food.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Washing hands with soap before eating removes germs and keeps us from getting sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. We must always wash our hands with soap before eating food to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: It is okay to take sweets from a stranger.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should NEVER take sweets or anything from a stranger. We should tell our parents or teacher about it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Taking sweets from strangers is not safe. We should always say no and tell a parent or teacher.

questions.question_text: Anu just finished playing in the park. Her hands are dirty. What should she do before eating her snack?

options.text: Wash hands with soap and water

questions.explanation_correct: Anu should wash her hands with soap and water before eating. Dirty hands have germs that can make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating with dirty hands or just wiping on clothes does not remove germs. Anu must wash her hands properly with soap and water.

questions.question_text: Rohan enters the classroom late. The teacher is already teaching. What should Rohan say?

options.text: Start the class again for me

questions.explanation_correct: Rohan should say 'May I come in, please?' It is polite to ask permission when entering a room where others are already present.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking in without asking or demanding is rude. The polite thing is to say 'May I come in, please?' when entering late.

questions.question_text: A stranger in a car asks you to get in and offers to drive you home. What should you do?

options.text: Say no, run away, and tell a parent or teacher
Go if the car looks nice

questions.explanation_correct: You should say no, run away, and tell a parent or teacher immediately. Never get into a stranger's car, no matter what they say.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Getting into a stranger's car is very dangerous. Always say NO to strangers, move away quickly, and tell a trusted adult right away.

questions.question_text: What should we drink to stay healthy?
questions.explanation_correct: We should drink clean drinking water to stay healthy. Water helps our body work well and keeps us active.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cold drinks have too much sugar, dirty water can make us sick, and not drinking at all is harmful. Clean water is the best drink.

questions.question_text: What should we do after using the toilet?
questions.explanation_correct: We should wash our hands with soap after using the toilet. This removes germs and keeps us from spreading them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Just wiping on clothes or not washing is not clean. We must wash our hands with soap every time after using the toilet.

questions.question_text: Sita accidentally stepped on her friend's foot. What should she say?

options.text: Watch where you put your feet!
I am sorry, are you okay?

questions.explanation_correct: Sita should say 'I am sorry, are you okay?' Apologising when we accidentally hurt someone is good manners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Blaming the friend, laughing, or walking away is very rude. When we accidentally hurt someone, we should apologise and ask if they are okay.

questions.question_text: What should we do before crossing the road?

options.text: Look left, then right, then left again
Run as fast as we can

questions.explanation_correct: We should look left, then right, then left again before crossing the road. This helps us see if any vehicle is coming.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Closing eyes, running, or talking on the phone while crossing is very dangerous. Always look left-right-left before crossing.

questions.question_text: Rahul eats chips and throws the wrapper on the ground. Is this correct?

options.text: Yes, the sweeper will pick it up
No, he should throw it in a dustbin
Yes, it is just one wrapper

questions.explanation_correct: No, Rahul should throw the wrapper in a dustbin. Littering makes our surroundings dirty. We should always use a dustbin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Throwing wrappers on the ground is littering, no matter how small it is. We should always use a dustbin to keep our surroundings clean.

questions.question_text: Saying 'please' and 'thank you' are good manners.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Saying 'please' and 'thank you' are good manners. They show that we are polite and respectful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Using words like please and thank you shows good manners and makes others feel respected.

questions.question_text: We should cut our nails regularly to keep them clean.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. We should cut our nails regularly. Dirt can hide under long nails and cause germs to enter our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Cutting nails regularly is an important hygiene habit that prevents germs from hiding under our nails.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a good habit?
questions.explanation_correct: Sleeping on time at night is a good habit. Getting enough sleep keeps us healthy, active, and ready to learn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being rude, not sharing, and wasting food are bad habits. Sleeping on time is a good habit that keeps us healthy.

questions.question_text: Someone on the playground is making Meena feel uncomfortable by touching her. What should Meena do?

options.text: Say NO loudly and tell a parent or teacher

questions.explanation_correct: Meena should say NO loudly and immediately tell a parent or teacher. Our body belongs to us and no one should make us feel uncomfortable.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Staying quiet or forgetting about it is not safe. Meena must say NO loudly and tell a trusted adult like a parent or teacher right away.

questions.question_text: When should we take a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: We should take a bath every day. Bathing daily keeps our body clean, removes germs, and makes us feel fresh.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bathing only once a week or once a month is not enough. We should take a bath every day to stay clean and healthy.

questions.question_text: Anu's grandmother gives her a glass of milk. What should Anu say?
questions.explanation_correct: Anu should say 'Thank you, Dadi.' Saying thank you to our grandparents and elders is good manners and shows love.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being rude or saying nothing is not polite. When someone gives us something, we should always say thank you with a smile.

questions.question_text: Raju ate his lunch at school. What should he do with his lunch box wrapper and banana peel?

options.text: Throw them out of the window

questions.explanation_correct: Raju should put the wrapper and banana peel in the dustbin. Keeping our school clean is everyone's responsibility.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Throwing rubbish under the desk, on the floor, or out of the window is wrong. We must always use the dustbin.

questions.question_text: Ram is walking home from school. A stranger on the road says, 'Your mother sent me to pick you up.' What should Ram do?

options.text: Say no, go back to school, and tell the teacher

questions.explanation_correct: Ram should say no, go back to school, and tell his teacher. We should never go with strangers, even if they say they know our parents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stranger might lie about knowing our parents. Ram should NOT go with the stranger. He should go back to school and tell his teacher.

questions.question_text: It is good manners to chew food with our mouth open.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should chew food with our mouth closed. Eating with an open mouth is considered bad table manners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Good table manners include chewing food with our mouth closed, not open.

questions.question_text: What should we wear to keep our body clean?

options.text: The same clothes every day without washing

questions.explanation_correct: We should wear clean clothes. Wearing clean clothes helps us stay healthy, feel fresh, and look neat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wearing dirty or unwashed clothes can cause skin problems and smell bad. We should always wear clean clothes.

questions.question_text: Two children are talking. One of them sneezes. What should the sneezing child do?

options.text: Sneeze on the other child's face
Cover mouth with elbow or tissue and say sorry

questions.explanation_correct: The child should cover their mouth with their elbow or a tissue when sneezing. This prevents germs from spreading to others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sneezing on others or not covering our mouth spreads germs. We should always cover our mouth when sneezing.

questions.question_text: Where should we walk on a busy road?

options.text: In the middle of the road
On the wrong side of the road

questions.explanation_correct: We should walk on the footpath (pavement) on a busy road. The footpath is made for people to walk safely away from traffic.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking in the middle of the road or behind a truck is very dangerous. The footpath is the safest place to walk.

questions.question_text: Priya sees a mosquito breeding in stagnant water near her house. What should be done?

options.text: Remove the stagnant water so mosquitoes don't breed

questions.explanation_correct: The stagnant water should be removed. Mosquitoes lay eggs in standing water, and they can spread diseases like dengue and malaria.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping stagnant water or playing in it is harmful. We must remove standing water to stop mosquitoes from breeding.

questions.question_text: What is the right time for children to go to sleep?

options.text: Very late at night, after midnight
Only when they feel like it

questions.explanation_correct: Children should go to sleep early at night, around 8-9 PM. Getting enough sleep helps children grow and learn well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Staying up very late is not healthy for children. Going to bed early around 8-9 PM gives our body enough rest to grow and stay healthy.

questions.question_text: If a stranger offers to show you a cute puppy, you should go with them.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should NEVER go with a stranger, even if they offer to show us a puppy or kitten. Say no and tell a trusted adult.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Strangers may use tricks like puppies or kittens to lure children. Never go with a stranger.

questions.question_text: We should comb our hair ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We should comb our hair every day. Combing keeps our hair neat, clean, and tangle-free.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Combing only once a month or never will make our hair messy and tangled. We should comb our hair every day.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a BAD habit?
questions.explanation_correct: Littering on the road is a bad habit. It makes our surroundings dirty and can spread diseases. We should use a dustbin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saying please, washing hands, and sleeping on time are all good habits. Littering on the road is a bad habit.

questions.question_text: What should you do if you are lost in a market?

options.text: Go with any stranger who offers to help
Stay where you are and ask a shopkeeper or police officer for help
Keep walking and hope to find your way

questions.explanation_correct: If lost, stay where you are and ask a shopkeeper or police officer for help. Do not go with any random stranger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Going with a stranger or wandering around is not safe. If lost, stay calm, stay put, and ask a shopkeeper or police officer for help.

questions.question_text: After playing outside, Anu's shoes are dirty. What should she do before entering the house?

options.text: Clean or remove her shoes at the door
Nothing, the house will stay clean

questions.explanation_correct: Anu should clean or remove her shoes at the door. This keeps the house clean and prevents dirt from coming inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking in with dirty shoes or wiping them on furniture is wrong. We should clean or remove shoes at the door to keep the house clean.

questions.question_text: Someone is eating while you are waiting. You are feeling hungry. What is the polite thing to do?
questions.explanation_correct: The polite thing is to wait patiently for your turn. Patience is a good habit and shows respect for others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Grabbing food, shouting, or crying is not polite. We should wait patiently for our turn, which shows good manners.

questions.question_text: Drinking dirty water can make us sick.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Dirty water has germs that can make us very sick. We should always drink clean, safe drinking water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Dirty water contains germs that cause diseases. We must always drink clean water.

questions.question_text: While walking to school, a dog starts chasing Priya. What should she do?

options.text: Run as fast as she can
Stand still, avoid eye contact, and slowly back away

questions.explanation_correct: Priya should stand still, avoid looking directly at the dog, and slowly back away. Running can make the dog chase faster.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running makes dogs chase more, throwing stones is cruel, and petting a stray dog is risky. Standing still and slowly backing away is safest.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a daily cleanliness habit?
questions.explanation_correct: Eating pizza is not a cleanliness habit. Brushing teeth, taking a bath, and combing hair are daily cleanliness habits.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Brushing teeth, bathing, and combing hair are all cleanliness habits. Eating pizza is about food, not cleanliness.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows GOOD manners?

options.text: Talking with mouth full of food
Waiting for your turn in a line

questions.explanation_correct: Waiting for your turn in a line shows good manners. Being patient and not pushing others is respectful behaviour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Talking with mouth full, pushing in a queue, and shouting in a library are all bad manners. Waiting for your turn shows good manners.

questions.question_text: Which phone number should you call in an emergency in India?
questions.explanation_correct: In India, we can call 100 (police), 101 (fire), 102 (ambulance), or 112 (emergency number) for help during emergencies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 123, 999, and 555 are not Indian emergency numbers. In India, 100 is for police, 101 for fire, 102 for ambulance, and 112 is the universal emergency number.

questions.question_text: Ravi has a cold. He is coughing and sneezing. What should he do to keep others safe?

options.text: Cover his mouth and wash hands often
Share his water bottle with friends

questions.explanation_correct: Ravi should cover his mouth when coughing and wash his hands often. This stops germs from spreading to other people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Coughing on others or sharing water bottles when sick spreads germs. Ravi should cover his mouth and wash hands to keep others safe.

questions.question_text: We should always tell our parents or teachers if someone makes us feel scared or uncomfortable.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. We should always tell our parents or teachers if someone makes us scared or uncomfortable. Trusted adults can help us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. It is very important to tell parents or teachers when we feel scared. They will help keep us safe.

questions.question_text: Which set has ALL good habits?

options.text: Washing hands, sleeping on time, saying please
Eating junk food, wasting water, being lazy

questions.explanation_correct: Washing hands, sleeping on time, and saying please are ALL good habits. They help us stay healthy and be nice to others.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Littering, being rude, not bathing, fighting, wasting water, and being lazy are all bad habits. Only option B has all good habits.

questions.question_text: Anu is playing near a busy road. Her ball rolls onto the road. What should she do?

options.text: Run onto the road to get the ball
Ask an adult to help get the ball safely
Wait for a car to push it back

questions.explanation_correct: Anu should ask an adult to help get the ball safely. Running onto a busy road is very dangerous, even for a ball.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running onto a busy road to get a ball is very dangerous. Anu should ask an adult for help to get the ball safely.

questions.question_text: Why is it important to have good habits?

options.text: To stay healthy, safe, and be a good person

questions.explanation_correct: Good habits are important because they help us stay healthy, safe, and be a good person. They make our life and others' lives better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Good habits are not about showing off or being forced. They are truly important because they keep us healthy, safe, and help us become good people.
